skill.name: latchbio-integration
skill.description: Latch platform for bioinformatics workflows. Build pipelines with Latch SDK, @workflow/@task decorators, deploy serverless workflows, LatchFile/LatchDir, Nextflow/Snakemake integration.
skill.summary: Latch platform for bioinformatics workflows. Build pipelines with Latch SDK, @workflow/@task decorat...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only reference guides for using the Latch SDK platform. No scripts, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: Building bioinformatics pipelines requires learning platform-specific tools and cloud infrastructure. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for creating serverless workflows using the Latch SDK with decorators, data abstractions, and verified bioinformatics tools.
actual_capabilities: Manage cloud data with LatchFile and LatchDir abstractions
Configure CPU, memory, GPU, and storage resources
Import pre-built verified workflows (RNA-seq, AlphaFold, DESeq2)
Organize experimental data with Registry system
limitations: Requires existing Latch account and Docker installation
Cannot execute workflows locally without additional setup
Does not provide compute resources - requires Latch platform access
Verified workflows depend on external tool versions maintained by Latch

use_cases.title: Deploy RNA-seq analysis pipelines
use_cases.description: Build reproducible RNA-seq pipelines with quality control, alignment, and quantification using verified workflows

use_cases.title: Run protein structure prediction
use_cases.description: Execute AlphaFold and ColabFold predictions on GPU resources with automatic result organization

use_cases.title: Integrate existing pipelines
use_cases.description: Port existing Nextflow or Snakemake workflows to cloud with minimal code changes

prompt_templates.title: Create basic workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Latch workflow for processing FASTQ files with @small_task and @workflow decorators

prompt_templates.title: Configure GPU resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure GPU resources for protein structure prediction using @large_gpu_task or custom_task with A100 GPU

prompt_templates.title: Import Nextflow pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Import my existing Nextflow pipeline to Latch using latch register --nextflow command

prompt_templates.title: Use verified workflows
prompt_templates.prompt: Run bulk RNA-seq analysis using the latch.verified.bulk_rnaseq workflow with sample metadata

output_examples.input: Create a Latch workflow for RNA-seq analysis with quality control and alignment
output: Create @workflow combining all tasks with LatchFile inputs
Register workflow with latch register command

best_practices: Use type annotations for all workflow parameters to enable automatic UI generation
Start with standard task decorators (@small_task, @large_task) and scale resources only when profiling shows need
Break complex workflows into modular tasks for better debugging and parallel execution
Test workflows locally with Docker before deploying to Latch platform
anti_patterns: Using @large_gpu_task for tasks that do not require GPU acceleration
Skipping type annotations which disables automatic UI generation
Over-allocating CPU and memory without profiling actual requirements
Registering workflows without testing dependencies in local Docker container

faq.question: What programming languages does Latch support for workflows?
faq.answer: Latch supports native Python workflows using the SDK, along with Nextflow and Snakemake pipelines. All workflows run in Docker containers.

faq.question: What compute resources are available for tasks?
faq.answer: Tasks can use CPU cores up to 96, memory up to 768GB, and GPUs including K80, V100, and A100. Use @small_task, @large_task, @small_gpu_task, @large_gpu_task, or @custom_task for specific configurations.

faq.question: How do I integrate Latch workflows with external tools?
faq.answer: Use LatchFile and LatchDir to reference cloud data. Verified workflows like bulk_rnaseq, alphafold, and deseq2 can be imported directly from latch.verified module. Custom tasks can call any command-line tool included in your Docker image.

faq.question: Is my data secure on the Latch platform?
faq.answer: Latch provides encrypted cloud storage. Files are transferred securely between your local environment and cloud storage. Use Registry for structured data with access controls.

faq.question: Why is my workflow registration failing?
faq.answer: Common issues include Docker not running, authentication token expired (run latch login), missing dependencies in Dockerfile, or syntax errors in workflow code. Use latch register --verbose for detailed logs.

faq.question: How does Latch compare to other workflow platforms?
faq.answer: Latch provides automatic containerization, generated no-code UIs, and verified bioinformatics workflows. Unlike AWS Batch or Google Cloud Life Sciences, Latch includes pre-built tools and a managed compute environment.
